title: NEONSCAN
description: NeonScan allows you to explore and search the Neon blockchain for transactions, addresses, tokens, prices and other activities taking place on Neon (NEON)
home.title: {chain} blockchain explorer
tx.tip.hash: Also known as Block Number. The block height, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of the new block.
tx.tip.block: The number of the block in which the transaction was recorded. Block confirmation indicate how many blocks since the transaction is validated.
tx.tip.timestamp: The date and time at which a transaction is validated.
tx.tip.from: The sending party of the transaction (could be from a contract address).
tx.tip.to: The receiving party of the transaction (could be a contract address).
tx.tip.value: The value being transacted in {symbol} and fiat value. Note: You can click the fiat value (if available) to see historical value at the time of transaction.
tx.tip.fee: Amount paid to the miner for processing the transaction.
tx.tip.gasprice: Cost per unit of gas specified for the transaction, in {symbol} and Gwei. The higher the gas price the higher chance of getting included in a block.
tx.tip.gaslimit: Maximum amount of gas allocated for the transaction & the amount eventually used. Normal {symbol} transfers involve 21,000 gas units while contracts involve higher values.
tx.tip.maxfee: The maximum fee per unit of gas for this transaction.
tx.tip.maxPriority: The maximum priority fee per unit of gas for this transaction.
tx.tip.cumulative: cumulativeGasUsed is the sum of gasUsed by this transaction and all preceding transactions in the same block.
tx.tip.nonce: Sequential running number for an address, beginning with 0 for the first transaction. For example, if the nonce of a transaction is 10, it would be the 11th transaction sent from the sender's address.
tx.tip.input: Additional information that is required for the transaction.
